Message.Title: Why is Amazon worth this much?
Message.Msg: I don't own any Amazon, and I don't plan to buy any, but I have a question of those who do own it. Why is this stock worth what it is selling for. As far as I can see, they don't have much if any earnings, and they don't pay any dividend. Why for instance wouldn't wal-mart be a much better buy? They are making 4 bucks a share, pay a nice dividend, and cost about 1/4th as much as Amazon.

Having said that, it looks to me that some of the institutional holders know what is coming and are being prudent. As I said, the ROIC on the SS is dropping fast...

Tech, Youre right. Its not the retail option crackhead crowd doing it. Its the robots doing it to the retail optionz crack head crowd. Yet you bozos insist on playing theze scamz over and over again.... The definition of insanity: repeating the same process and expecting a different outcome.

That's where you are wrong. This move hasn't been about options, but has certainly been amplified by them. It has been a classic short squeeze to incite a performance chase, not only here but market wide. The self reinforcing technical trader driven momentum has massively exacerbated the misallocation of capital. The outcome will be different, just not until March in all likelihood...

Tech, A 'classic short squeeze' iz nflx from 50 to 200 in 2 days or what you see on lnkd (which is going much higher) or any other stock were you see north of 8-25% of its float shorted... When a stock iz 2% or less shorted its pretty hard to have the dynamics of a classic short squeze. Now when amzn ran to 300 and cmg, and pcln, and gmcr being walked (not ran) up to their highs in a linear fashion, that iz weekly optionz fueling those trainwrecks, and in the end they are alwayz trainwrecks. You need to study your market mechanics and dynamics more, and focus less on discounted cash flowz and enterprize 'value' for until you do you will stay lost in the optionz trap. Levered etfs also feed the optionz machine... This entire market iz base loaded with bernanke bux, and the money iz being made by the institutionz that got base loaded with the newly created optionz regulationz that they are gaming... Wake up bro - you seem smart sometimez.

I agree mostly with Sybil on this one. But if you must trade options, it is always better to be a seller, then time is working in your favor at least. On AMZN, I would just sell the $400 (or higher) Calls 2014 or 2015. You won't make a fortune, but you can sleep at night.

Topic.Title: Somethng is seriously wrong with this whole market.

Message.Msg: " I've been here for 4 years + when you were itching your daddy's pants. And I'll be here many more. " Hope you don't dissapear when this thing crashes.

"But if you must trade options, it is always better to be a seller, then time is working in your favor at least." This iz wrong because it misses one major component... It should read... But if you must trade options, it is always better to be a seller, then time is working in your favor at least as long as the option seller has control over a statistically significant portion of the float, and ownz robots that can crunch nano second statistics on live realtime streaming fed data that are programmed by mathematicianz that can handle graduate statistics at princeton university, or an engineer capable of handling mathematical course work at MIT. Under these circumstances, selling optionz works because the probabilities of control a statistically significant portion of the float can be calculated to win with a mathematical degree of a confidence interval. Unless you can do this, and have massive gun powder of opms to own the float required for statistics and probabilitiez to work the option seller iz #$%$ in the wind. Your dayz az a retail option seller will be numbered. Slowly but surely, more and more retailerz are thinking "i can be like the institutionz, i can sell optionz and make money". The day will come that enough idiots will take this tact that anybody with a robot can clealy see in real time, and that iz the day the robots turn from put option sellerz to put option buyerz of nice cheap put optionz and then fully unload their float and put that option right back to the retailer that 'out smarted' a robot backed by a programmer that graduated princeton mathematics and iz plugged directly into the NYSE soon to be the ICE world wide platform.... Optionz in any form for the retailer are derivative crack. Sybil highly recommendz that retailerz stick with the tried and true good sheit of the underlying cocain az opposed to getting hooked on synthetics... This iz why in the end all retail option traderz end up skinny with rotten teeth.... They simply do not understand what they are up against.
